=======================================================
IRID12.LOG /// IRI-90 RUN WITH EXAMPLES /// NOV 19 1991
=======================================================
Below is the protocol of a IRID12 session showing the 
text displayed on the user's screen.

Please note: <CR> stands for carriage return. It indicates
the user input lines.



       **** INTERNATIONAL REFERENCE IONOSPHERE 1990 ****
***************************************************************
THIS PROGRAM ALLOWS YOU TO PRODUCE TABLES OF IRI PARAMETERS VARYING
WITH LATITUDE, LONGITUDE,SOLAR ACTIVITY,MONTH,TIME OR ALTITUDE.
***************************************************************
 In each of the following windows you will be asked to enter
 one or more values, defining the conditions for your IRI 
 tables.
 In each window the current value(s) is (are) shown in the right
 upper corner (# .. #). You can choose the current value(s) by
 entering / at the prompt
 If you enter a wrong character or a value outside the allowed
 parameter range, the program will ask you for a new entry.
 After your tables are displayed, you can change any parameter
 you wish to change and create a new profile.
 You can leave the program at any point by entering Ctrl Z.
************************** GOOD LUCK **************************

DO YOU WANT YOUR IRI-PROFILES                           #0#
    DISPLAYED ON YOUR MONITOR:  ENTER  0  AT PROMPT
    STORED IN FILE OUTPUT.IRI:  ENTER  1  AT PROMPT
    DISPLAYED AND STORED     :  ENTER  2  AT PROMPT
------------------------------------------------------------
Enter /, to continue with current value(s); Ctrl Z, to exit
n
Your input value is outside the value range: 0 to  2, try again
3
Your input value is outside the value range: 0 to  2, try again
0

DO YOU WANT MESSAGES                                     #1#
    DISPLAYED ON YOUR MONITOR:  ENTER  0  AT PROMPT
    STORED IN FILE KONSOL.IRI:  ENTER  1  AT PROMPT
    STORED IN FILE OUTPUT.IRI:  ENTER  2  AT PROMPT
------------------------------------------------------------
Enter /, to continue with current value(s); Ctrl Z, to exit
/


SELECT YOUR VARIABLE:                                   #6#

                                 Geodetic or geomagnetic coordinates
                                 are assumed depending on your later
1  LATITUDE    4  MONTH          selection of JMAG.
2  LONGITUDE   5  HOUR           Variation in UNIVERSAL TIME is selected
3  RZ12        6  ALTITUDE       by adding "25" to your BEGIN hour
7  DAYNR                         in the next window.
------------------------------------------------------------
Enter /, to continue with current value(s); Ctrl Z, to exit
/


CHOOSE YOUR VARIABLE RANGE:    BEGIN,  END , STEPWIDTH ?
                             # 100.0,1000.0, 100.0#
------------------------------------------------------------
Enter /, to continue with current value(s); Ctrl Z, to exit
/


JMAG ?                                                   #0#

!! "0" geodetic longitude and latitude
!! "1"    geomagnetic   ... 
------------------------------------------------------------
Enter /, to continue with current value(s); Ctrl Z, to exit
/


GEOD. LATITUDE ?   !NORTH!   [DEGREE,DECIMAL]        # 45.1#
------------------------------------------------------------
Enter /, to continue with current value(s); Ctrl Z, to exit
/


GEOD. LONGITUDE ?   !EAST!   [DEGREE,DECIMAL]        #293.1#
------------------------------------------------------------
Enter /, to continue with current value(s); Ctrl Z, to exit
/


SOLAR SUNSPOT NUMBER ?   !12-MONTH-RUNNING MEAN!    #100.0#
------------------------------------------------------------
Enter /, to continue with current value(s); Ctrl Z, to exit
/


DATE ?   * MONTH&DAY (MMDD) or DAY OF YEAR (-DDD) *   #1015#
------------------------------------------------------------
Enter /, to continue with current value(s); Ctrl Z, to exit
/


HOUR ?              [HOURS, DECIMAL]                  #12.5#

!! UNIVERSAL TIME (UT) can be chosen by entering HOUR=UT+25.
!! If HOUR is less 25, than LOCAL TIME is assumed
------------------------------------------------------------
Enter /, to continue with current value(s); Ctrl Z, to exit
/

WHICH PARAMETERS SHOULD BE CALCULATED ?                  #1#
------------------------------------------------------------
    1 - ALL PARAMETERS
    2 - ONLY ELECTRON DENSITY
    3 - ONLY TEMPERATURES
    4 - ONLY ION COMPOSITION
    5 - DENSITY AND TEMPERATURES
    6 - DENSITY AND ION COMPOSITION
    7 - TEMPERATURES AND ION COMPOSITION
------------------------------------------------------------
Enter /, to continue with current value(s); Ctrl Z, to exit
/


SELECTION OF DENSITY OPTIONS:                          #  2#
------------------------------------------------------------
    1 - OLD-B0:   B0-table
    2 - NEW-B0:   Gulyaeva-h0.5 (!recommended choice!) 
    3 - OLD-TS:   Topside as in IRI 1979
------------------------------------------------------------
    4 - LAY:      analytical LAY-representation for the E-F
                  region using HMF1(SZA) formula and Gul.-B0.
------------------------------------------------------------
ION COMPOSITION: - Enter the chosen option as a negative
number, if you would like to use the Danilov-Yaichnikov
ion composition model.
------------------------------------------------------------
Enter /, to continue with current value(s); Ctrl Z, to exit
/


NMF2/FOF2 input ?    * F PEAK DENSITY / FREQUENCY *      #2#
------------------------------------------------------------
!! OPTIONS:  enter  0    if you want to enter your own
!!                       NMF2/m-3 (or foF2/MHz) values.
!!           enter  1    if you want to use the CCIR-67 model
!!           enter  2    if you want to use the URSI-89 model
!!                       URSI-89 was adopted as IRI standard.
------------------------------------------------------------
Enter /, to continue with current value(s); Ctrl Z, to exit
/


HMF2-input ?            * F PEAK ALTITUDE *              #1#
------------------------------------------------------------
!! OPTIONS: enter  0   if you want to enter HMF2/km values.
!!          enter  1   if you want to use the CCIR-M3000 based model
------------------------------------------------------------
Enter /, to continue with current value(s); Ctrl Z, to exit
/


 NE(300), NE(400), NE(600) ?    [m-3]
                                #0.00E+00,0.00E+00,0.00E+00#
------------------------------------------------------------
!! ELECTRON TEMPERATURE:
!!    Option to use the electron density (NE) dependent
!!    models at 300, 400, 600 km altitude
!!    (NE(H)=0  model is not used at altitude h).
------------------------------------------------------------
!!    This option is only allowed, when you generate
!!    altitude profiles (i.e. variable=height).
------------------------------------------------------------
Enter /, to continue with current value(s); Ctrl Z, to exit
/
*** IRI parameters are being calculated ***
Ne, B0: Bottomside thickness is obtained with Gulyaeva-1987 model.
Ne, foF2: URSI model is used.










   H/KM  ELECTRON DENSITY      TEMPERATURES       ION PERCENTAGE DENSITIES
         NE/CM-3 NE/NMF2  TN/K  TI/K  TE/K  TE/TI   O+   H+  He+  O2+  NO+
  100.0   122870  0.1054    -1    -1    -1  -1.00    0    0    0   46   54
  200.0   262945  0.2255   967   967  1422   1.47   88    0    0    5    8
  300.0  1159942  0.9948  1091  1111  2292   2.06  100    0    0    0    0
  400.0   823790  0.7065  1108  1256  2755   2.19  100    0    0    0    0
  500.0   442846  0.3798  1110  1506  2794   1.86   96    4    0    0    0
  600.0   248429  0.2131  1111  1803  2810   1.56   88   10    1    0    0
  700.0   164867  0.1414  1111  2100  2883   1.37   80   18    2    0    0
  800.0   128017  0.1098  1111  2397  2966   1.24   69   28    3    0    0
  900.0   110757  0.0950  1111  2693  3050   1.13   59   37    4    0    0
 1000.0   102289  0.0877  1111  2990  3133   1.05   50   45    5    0    0
I-URSI --B0Gul-----------I-----------------------I-----------------------I
LAT/LON= 45.1/293.1    H=1000.0  RZ12=100.0 MMDD:1015  LT:12.5  SZA= 54.8
MLA/MLO= 56.5/  3.7  DIP= 72.4  F10.7=145.4  DDD: 288  UT:17.0  SDE= -8.8
--------------------------------------------------------------------------

**** DO YOU WANT TO CONTINUE?
------------------------------------------------------------
"0"  QUIT AND EXIT        "1"  NEW PARAMETERS
"2"  DIFFERENT ALTITUDE RANGE
------------------------------------------------------------
2
BEGIN, END, STEPWIDTH   [KM]          # 100.0,1000.0, 100.0#
------------------------------------------------------------
Enter /, to continue with current value(s); Ctrl Z, to exit
100,300,20










   H/KM  ELECTRON DENSITY      TEMPERATURES       ION PERCENTAGE DENSITIES
         NE/CM-3 NE/NMF2  TN/K  TI/K  TE/K  TE/TI   O+   H+  He+  O2+  NO+
  100.0   122870  0.1054    -1    -1    -1  -1.00    0    0    0   46   54
  120.0   131611  0.1129   371   371   371   1.00    2    0    0   45   53
  140.0   141662  0.1215   621   621   635   1.02    9    0    0   37   54
  160.0   148699  0.1275   786   786   898   1.14   36    0    0   27   37
  180.0   155736  0.1336   895   895  1161   1.30   74    0    0   13   12
  200.0   262945  0.2255   967   967  1422   1.47   88    0    0    5    8
  220.0   633397  0.5432  1015  1015  1635   1.61   91    0    0    2    7
  240.0   950944  0.8156  1046  1046  1804   1.72   94    0    0    1    6
  260.0  1104153  0.9470  1067  1067  1971   1.85   96    0    0    0    4
  280.0  1161815  0.9964  1082  1082  2138   1.98   99    0    0    0    1
  300.0  1159942  0.9948  1091  1111  2292   2.06  100    0    0    0    0
I-URSI --B0Gul-----------I-----------------------I-----------------------I
LAT/LON= 45.1/293.1    H= 300.0  RZ12=100.0 MMDD:1015  LT:12.5  SZA= 54.8
MLA/MLO= 56.5/  3.7  DIP= 72.4  F10.7=145.4  DDD: 288  UT:17.0  SDE= -8.8
--------------------------------------------------------------------------

**** DO YOU WANT TO CONTINUE?
------------------------------------------------------------
"0"  QUIT AND EXIT        "1"  NEW PARAMETERS
"2"  DIFFERENT ALTITUDE RANGE
------------------------------------------------------------
1


**** WHICH PARAMETER DO YOU WANT TO CHANGE?
------------------------------------------------------------
0  NO FURTHER CHANGES, CALCULATE PROFILE
1  LATITUDE  # 45.1#        7  GEOD.(0) OR GEOM.(1)    #0#
2  LONGITUDE #293.1#        8  SELECTION OF VARIABLE   # H/KM#
3  ALTITUDE  # 100.0#       9  VARIABLE RANGE  #   100.0   300.0    20.0#
4  RZ12      #100.0#       10  PARAMETER CHOICES AND OPTIONS
5  MONTH,DAY #10 15#       11  F PEAK VALUES
6  LT        # 12.5#       12  TE(NE) MODEL
                           13  DISPLAY OF PROFILE AND MESSAGES
----------------------------------------------------------------------
ENTER NUMBER
10

WHICH PARAMETERS SHOULD BE CALCULATED ?                  #1#
------------------------------------------------------------
    1 - ALL PARAMETERS
    2 - ONLY ELECTRON DENSITY
    3 - ONLY TEMPERATURES
    4 - ONLY ION COMPOSITION
    5 - DENSITY AND TEMPERATURES
    6 - DENSITY AND ION COMPOSITION
    7 - TEMPERATURES AND ION COMPOSITION
------------------------------------------------------------
Enter /, to continue with current value(s); Ctrl Z, to exit
6


SELECTION OF DENSITY OPTIONS:                          #  2#
------------------------------------------------------------
    1 - OLD-B0:   B0-table
    2 - NEW-B0:   Gulyaeva-h0.5 (!recommended choice!) 
    3 - OLD-TS:   Topside as in IRI 1979
------------------------------------------------------------
    4 - LAY:      analytical LAY-representation for the E-F
                  region using HMF1(SZA) formula and Gul.-B0.
------------------------------------------------------------
ION COMPOSITION: - Enter the chosen option as a negative
number, if you would like to use the Danilov-Yaichnikov
ion composition model.
------------------------------------------------------------
Enter /, to continue with current value(s); Ctrl Z, to exit
1


**** WHICH PARAMETER DO YOU WANT TO CHANGE?
------------------------------------------------------------
0  NO FURTHER CHANGES, CALCULATE PROFILE
1  LATITUDE  # 45.1#        7  GEOD.(0) OR GEOM.(1)    #0#
2  LONGITUDE #293.1#        8  SELECTION OF VARIABLE   # H/KM#
3  ALTITUDE  # 100.0#       9  VARIABLE RANGE  #   100.0   300.0    20.0#
4  RZ12      #100.0#       10  PARAMETER CHOICES AND OPTIONS
5  MONTH,DAY #10 15#       11  F PEAK VALUES
6  LT        # 12.5#       12  TE(NE) MODEL
                           13  DISPLAY OF PROFILE AND MESSAGES
----------------------------------------------------------------------
ENTER NUMBER
11


NMF2/FOF2 input ?    * F PEAK DENSITY / FREQUENCY *      #2#
------------------------------------------------------------
!! OPTIONS:  enter  0    if you want to enter your own
!!                       NMF2/m-3 (or foF2/MHz) values.
!!           enter  1    if you want to use the CCIR-67 model
!!           enter  2    if you want to use the URSI-89 model
!!                       URSI-89 was adopted as IRI standard.
------------------------------------------------------------
Enter /, to continue with current value(s); Ctrl Z, to exit
1


HMF2-input ?            * F PEAK ALTITUDE *              #1#
------------------------------------------------------------
!! OPTIONS: enter  0   if you want to enter HMF2/km values.
!!          enter  1   if you want to use the CCIR-M3000 based model
------------------------------------------------------------
Enter /, to continue with current value(s); Ctrl Z, to exit
/


**** WHICH PARAMETER DO YOU WANT TO CHANGE?
------------------------------------------------------------

                           13  DISPLAY OF PROFILE AND MESSAGES
----------------------------------------------------------------------
ENTER NUMBER
0
*** IRI parameters are being calculated ***
Ne, foF2: CCIR model is used.










   H/KM  ELECTRON DENSITY      TEMPERATURES       ION PERCENTAGE DENSITIES
         NE/CM-3 NE/NMF2  TN/K  TI/K  TE/K  TE/TI   O+   H+  He+  O2+  NO+
  100.0   122870  0.0977    -1    -1    -1  -1.00    0    0    0   46   54
  120.0   131611  0.1047    -1    -1    -1  -1.00    2    0    0   45   53
  140.0   178062  0.1416    -1    -1    -1  -1.00    9    0    0   37   54
  160.0   229502  0.1826    -1    -1    -1  -1.00   36    0    0   27   37
  180.0   300015  0.2387    -1    -1    -1  -1.00   74    0    0   13   12
  200.0   539736  0.4293    -1    -1    -1  -1.00   88    0    0    5    8
  220.0   808388  0.6430    -1    -1    -1  -1.00   91    0    0    2    7
  240.0  1041189  0.8282    -1    -1    -1  -1.00   94    0    0    1    6
  260.0  1191351  0.9477    -1    -1    -1  -1.00   96    0    0    0    4
  280.0  1252164  0.9961    -1    -1    -1  -1.00   99    0    0    0    1

    1 - ALL PARAMETERS
    2 - ONLY ELECTRON DENSITY

    5 - DENSITY AND TEMPERATURES
    6 - DENSITY AND ION COMPOSITION
    7 - TEMPERATURES AND ION COMPOSITION
------------------------------------------------------------
Enter /, to continue with current value(s); Ctrl Z, to exit
1


SELECTION OF DENSITY OPTIONS:                          #  1#
------------------------------------------------------------
    1 - OLD-B0:   B0-table
    2 - NEW-B0:   Gulyaeva-h0.5 (!recommended choice!) 
    3 - OLD-TS:   Topside as in IRI 1979
------------------------------------------------------------
    4 - LAY:      analytical LAY-representation for the E-F
                  region using HMF1(SZA) formula and Gul.-B0.
------------------------------------------------------------
ION COMPOSITION: - Enter the chosen option as a negative
number, if you would like to use the Danilov-Yaichnikov
ion composition model.
------------------------------------------------------------
Enter /, to continue with current value(s); Ctrl Z, to exit
-4


**** WHICH PARAMETER DO YOU WANT TO CHANGE?
------------------------------------------------------------
0  NO FURTHER CHANGES, CALCULATE PROFILE
1  LATITUDE  # 45.1#        7  GEOD.(0) OR GEOM.(1)    #0#
2  LONGITUDE #293.1#        8  SELECTION OF VARIABLE   # H/KM#
3  ALTITUDE  # 100.0#       9  VARIABLE RANGE  #   100.0   300.0    20.0#
4  RZ12      #100.0#       10  PARAMETER CHOICES AND OPTIONS
5  MONTH,DAY #10 15#       11  F PEAK VALUES
6  LT        # 12.5#       12  TE(NE) MODEL
                           13  DISPLAY OF PROFILE AND MESSAGES
----------------------------------------------------------------------
ENTER NUMBER
12


 NE(300), NE(400), NE(600) ?    [m-3]
                                #0.00E+00,0.00E+00,0.00E+00#
------------------------------------------------------------
!! ELECTRON TEMPERATURE:
!!    Option to use the electron density (NE) dependent
!!    models at 300, 400, 600 km altitude
!!    (NE(H)=0  model is not used at altitude h).
------------------------------------------------------------
!!    This option is only allowed, when you generate
!!    altitude profiles (i.e. variable=height).
------------------------------------------------------------
Enter /, to continue with current value(s); Ctrl Z, to exit
1.1e12,0,0


**** WHICH PARAMETER DO YOU WANT TO CHANGE?
------------------------------------------------------------
0  NO FURTHER CHANGES, CALCULATE PROFILE
1  LATITUDE  # 45.1#        7  GEOD.(0) OR GEOM.(1)    #0#
2  LONGITUDE #293.1#        8  SELECTION OF VARIABLE   # H/KM#
3  ALTITUDE  # 100.0#       9  VARIABLE RANGE  #   100.0   300.0    20.0#
4  RZ12      #100.0#       10  PARAMETER CHOICES AND OPTIONS
5  MONTH,DAY #10 15#       11  F PEAK VALUES
6  LT        # 12.5#       12  TE(NE) MODEL
                           13  DISPLAY OF PROFILE AND MESSAGES
----------------------------------------------------------------------
ENTER NUMBER
0
*** IRI parameters are being calculated ***
Ne, E-F: The LAY-Version is prelimenary. Erroneous profile features can occur.
Ne, B0: Bottomside thickness is obtained with Gulyaeva-1987 model.
Ne, foF2: CCIR model is used.
Ion Com.: Using Danilov-Yaichnikov-1985.
Te: Temperature-density correlation is used.










   H/KM  ELECTRON DENSITY      TEMPERATURES       ION PERCENTAGE DENSITIES
         NE/CM-3 NE/NMF2  TN/K  TI/K  TE/K  TE/TI   O+   H+  He+  O2+  NO+
  100.0   122870  0.0977    -1    -1    -1  -1.00    0    0    0   28   72
  120.0   130540  0.1038   371   371   371   1.00    0    0    0   34   66
  140.0   147674  0.1175   621   621   642   1.03    1    0    0   34   65
  160.0   180621  0.1437   786   786   912   1.16    9    0    0   30   61
  180.0   219722  0.1748   895   895  1183   1.32   37    0    0   19   43
  200.0   289296  0.2301   967   967  1443   1.49   74    0    0    8   18
  220.0   460517  0.3663  1015  1015  1553   1.53   91    0    0    2    6
  240.0   744965  0.5926  1046  1046  1523   1.46   97    0    0    1    2
  260.0  1048811  0.8343  1067  1067  1485   1.39   98    0    0    0    1
  280.0  1236211  0.9834  1082  1082  1448   1.34   98    0    0    0    1
  300.0  1252266  0.9961  1091  1111  1464   1.32   98    0    0    0    0
I-CCIR --B0Gul-LAY-------I-----------T(N)/3------I-----------DY----------I
LAT/LON= 45.1/293.1    H= 300.0  RZ12=100.0 MMDD:1015  LT:12.5  SZA= 54.8
MLA/MLO= 56.5/  3.7  DIP= 72.4  F10.7=145.4  DDD: 288  UT:17.0  SDE= -8.8
--------------------------------------------------------------------------

**** DO YOU WANT TO CONTINUE?
------------------------------------------------------------
"0"  QUIT AND EXIT        "1"  NEW PARAMETERS
"2"  DIFFERENT ALTITUDE RANGE
------------------------------------------------------------

**** WHICH PARAMETER DO YOU WANT TO CHANGE?
------------------------------------------------------------
0  NO FURTHER CHANGES, CALCULATE PROFILE
1  LATITUDE  # 45.1#        7  GEOD.(0) OR GEOM.(1)    #0#

3  ALTITUDE  # 100.0#       9  VARIABLE RANGE  #   100.0   300.0    20.0#
4  RZ12      #100.0#       10  PARAMETER CHOICES AND OPTIONS

                           13  DISPLAY OF PROFILE AND MESSAGES
----------------------------------------------------------------------
ENTER NUMBER
8


SELECT YOUR VARIABLE:                                   #6#

                                 Geodetic or geomagnetic coordinates
                                 are assumed depending on your later
1  LATITUDE    4  MONTH          selection of JMAG.
2  LONGITUDE   5  HOUR           Variation in UNIVERSAL TIME is selected
3  RZ12        6  ALTITUDE       by adding "25" to your BEGIN hour
7  DAYNR                         in the next window.
------------------------------------------------------------
Enter /, to continue with current value(s); Ctrl Z, to exit
5


CHOOSE YOUR VARIABLE RANGE:    BEGIN,  END , STEPWIDTH ?
                             # 100.0, 300.0,  20.0#

!! if you add 25 to your BEGIN hour, UNIVERSAL TIME is assumed,
!! otherwise LOCAL TIME
------------------------------------------------------------
Enter /, to continue with current value(s); Ctrl Z, to exit
25,22,2


CHOOSE THE VARIABLE TO BE SHOWN IN TABLE:                #0#
------------------------------------------------------------
enter    0     for LOCAL or UNIVERSAL TIME
         1     for SOLAR ZENITH ANGLE
!! This allows you to display the solar zenith angle rather 
!! than local or universal time in the final table.
!! It does not change the selected LT/UT range.
------------------------------------------------------------
Enter /, to continue with current value(s); Ctrl Z, to exit
/


**** WHICH PARAMETER DO YOU WANT TO CHANGE?
------------------------------------------------------------
0  NO FURTHER CHANGES, CALCULATE PROFILE
1  LATITUDE  # 45.1#        7  GEOD.(0) OR GEOM.(1)    #0#
2  LONGITUDE #293.1#        8  SELECTION OF VARIABLE   # HOUR#
3  ALTITUDE  # 100.0#       9  VARIABLE RANGE  #     0.0    22.0     2.0#
4  RZ12      #100.0#       10  PARAMETER CHOICES AND OPTIONS
5  MONTH,DAY #10 15#       11  F PEAK VALUES
6  UT+25     # 12.5#       12  TE(NE) MODEL
                           13  DISPLAY OF PROFILE AND MESSAGES
----------------------------------------------------------------------
ENTER NUMBER
3


ALTITUDE ?    [KM]                                  # 100.0#

!! ALTITUDE=0   tables of F2,F1,E, and D peak altitudes
!!              and densities are obtained
------------------------------------------------------------
Enter /, to continue with current value(s); Ctrl Z, to exit
300


**** WHICH PARAMETER DO YOU WANT TO CHANGE?
------------------------------------------------------------
0  NO FURTHER CHANGES, CALCULATE PROFILE
1  LATITUDE  # 45.1#        7  GEOD.(0) OR GEOM.(1)    #0#
2  LONGITUDE #293.1#        8  SELECTION OF VARIABLE   # HOUR#

*** IRI parameters are being calculated ***
Ne, E-F: The LAY-Version is prelimenary. Erroneous profile features can occur.
Ne, B0: Bottomside thickness is obtained with Gulyaeva-1987 model.
Ne, foF2: CCIR model is used.
Ion Com.: Using Danilov-Yaichnikov-1985.

10

WHICH PARAMETERS SHOULD BE CALCULATED ?                  #1#
------------------------------------------------------------
    1 - ALL PARAMETERS
    2 - ONLY ELECTRON DENSITY
    3 - ONLY TEMPERATURES
    4 - ONLY ION COMPOSITION
    5 - DENSITY AND TEMPERATURES
    6 - DENSITY AND ION COMPOSITION
    7 - TEMPERATURES AND ION COMPOSITION
------------------------------------------------------------
Enter /, to continue with current value(s); Ctrl Z, to exit
/


SELECTION OF DENSITY OPTIONS:                          # -4#
------------------------------------------------------------
    1 - OLD-B0:   B0-table
    2 - NEW-B0:   Gulyaeva-h0.5 (!recommended choice!) 
    3 - OLD-TS:   Topside as in IRI 1979
------------------------------------------------------------
    4 - LAY:      analytical LAY-representation for the E-F
                  region using HMF1(SZA) formula and Gul.-B0.
------------------------------------------------------------
ION COMPOSITION: - Enter the chosen option as a negative
number, if you would like to use the Danilov-Yaichnikov
ion composition model.
------------------------------------------------------------
Enter /, to continue with current value(s); Ctrl Z, to exit

CHOOSE THE VARIABLE TO BE SHOWN IN TABLE:                #0#
------------------------------------------------------------
enter    0     for GEODETIC or GEOMAGNETIC LATITUDE
         1     for MAGNETIC DIP LATITUDE
         2     for MODIFIED DIP LATITUDE (MODIP)
!! This allows you to display other latitude parameters
!! in the final table.
!! It does not change the selected parameter or parameter range.

*** IRI parameters are being calculated ***
Ne, B0: Bottomside thickness is obtained with Gulyaeva-1987 model.
Ne, foF2: URSI model is used.
